text.p: These are leading stories in this morning's Paris newspapers.
-- Bollore takes control of Rivaud group by buying rights to an outstanding 50.4 percent stake from the Ribes family.
-- Cuts in labour charges may have created some 120,000 to 145,000 jobs over five years, study shows.
-- Suez and Lyonnaise des Eaux to detail their planned merger within a week.
-- Junior doctors, on strike against tighter controls of health spending, strengthen movement.
-- Suez and Lyonnaise expected to finalise merger this week, plan to discuss it on April 11 after holding their board meetings this week.
-- Lafarge chairman Bertrand Collomb seeks to increase the group's international activities, improve profitability and widen the range of high-value-added products.
